page.title: 05Harpsden Church and Court
page.content: ST.MARGARETÂ£S is a Norman CHURCH,1100, built of flint & brick.It was restored in 1848.The dedication is to Margaret of Antioch.It has some 15th century brasses.Three Services are held each Sunday morning & Harpsden School Children have Services there each term. Opposite,decorating the exterior wall of the Barn are hand carved Wood Blocks once used for printing wallpaper. HARPSDEH COURT was a Manor House in 1204 & among the owners were the Halls & the Hodges who were linked with the School & Bolney Court.The House has been altered over the years & is now privately owned.Earthwoks(Pre-Roman) are in the grounds & remains of a Roman Villa are near in the woods.Some of the woods have been cleared for a Golf Course.Land once belonging to the Court is now used for grass,horses,hay,crops & an airstrip for a private plane.
